item.title: Household and food rubbish dumped, 16th June
item.description:
Some kind low life has decided it is better to dump their household food rubbish at the letterbox for the postman to take home, but as expected the postman decided against removing this pile of rotting food stuff, so now the foxes, cats and birds have ripped the bags open and now lays all over the pavement area making it disgusting to look at and is now encouraging rats.!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paroma Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corridors not cleaned for several weeks at Grainger Court, 16th June
item.description:
The floors have not been swept for weeks and following an abandoned fridge, which leaked outside Flat 3, the floors have become sticky in that area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Councillor Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TM Not Sufficient, 16th June
item.description:
SGN urgently need to strengthen their TM at the end of Palm Avenue jcn with Maidstone Rd. The cones have been moved and vehicles are now mounting the pavement on the corner which is very dangerous for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Maidstone Road, North Cray, London

item.title: Fire spark attempt, 16th June
item.description:
A fire was deliberately started last Friday, likely linked to the person previously using the area as a shelter — whose mattress was removed that morning. This is a serious safety risk. Please address the ongoing homelessness issue in this location.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunloe Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sand and litter in kerb and roadside, 16th June
item.description:
Sand in kerb and roadside Blissett Street opposite Jervis Court. Has been left since April and needs a good sweep along here please and jet wash. Caused by utiility company not clearing up their mess.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1 - 14, Greenwich South Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle at problem spot, 16th June
item.description:
This is an abandoned vehicle that has become a hotspot for dumping dodgy cars. I have reported 3 cars here already and they have all been removed. This one has been here for 6 months. It needs removing. Usually the council contact the owner of the adjacent land to have it removed. In this case, people have started fly tipping behind it also. Rotten food, waste and furniture. It’s becoming an environment health issue

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Courthill Road, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
